name: Another buyout-movie which destroys a wonderful story of a book! Poor.
reviewBody:
Did someone who consider this piece of Hollywood-crap good ever chose some spare tome to just read the book? Who did pay Peter Buchman, the author of the screenplay for this very poor piece? The plot is wrong, the story is not right... why didn't they tell the story as described in the book - it could have been so easy and would have been so much more fun! Where are the "knurlas", what happened to the reading of the minds of other creatures? I don't know where to start or to stop... and even big Hollywood names couldn't save it from being a piece of crap. This movie doesn't catch the spirit, soul and fantasy of the wonderful and very faithful novel by Christopher Paolini. The last thing I have to say about this movie: Boetq Istalri! Brisingr! Don't pay for this Hollywood-buyout destroyed movie... go buy the book and use your own fantasy...
